title: The Garden Grows
summary: I cultivate my mushroom garden, testing the limits of my new abilities. But I'm not alone in this vault—something moves in the deeper darkness.

images.description: Opening shot of Howen's mushroom garden, now expanded. Multiple bioluminescent species glow in different colors—purple, blue, pale green. Beautiful but alien.
images.caption: Day 7. Or what I'm calling Day 7. The garden grows.

images.description: Close-up of Howen's blade, with tiny fungal threads connecting her to the nearby mushrooms. She's learned to extend her influence.
images.caption: I can feel them all. Every spore, every cap, every mycelium thread. They're... part of me now.

images.description: Howen experiments—a mushroom grows rapidly under her focused attention, then shrinks back when she releases. Testing control.
images.caption: Grow. Stop. Grow. Stop. I'm getting better at this. More precise.

images.description: A different mushroom type—this one glows red when Howen focuses on it. She senses it's different. Volatile.
images.caption: This one feels... dangerous. The spores spark when they touch air. Boom mushroom. I should be careful with these.

images.description: Sound effect panel—skittering noises from the darkness beyond the garden. Howen's core flickers with alarm.
images.caption: What was that?

images.description: Howen dims her glow, watching the edge of the darkness. Multiple small shapes move just beyond the light.
images.caption: Something's out there. Multiple somethings. Small, fast, chitinous.

images.description: An insect emerges into the mushroom light—a megascarab nymph, small and curious. Translucent carapace, large eyes reflecting the bioluminescence.
images.caption: Insects. Young ones. They're... watching the mushrooms. Watching me.

images.description: More nymphs emerge, drawn by the light. They cluster at the edge of the garden, antennae waving. One nibbles tentatively at a mushroom.
images.caption: They're hungry. The garden must be the only food source down here.

images.description: Howen makes a decision—she deliberately grows a cluster of mushrooms toward the insects. An offering.
images.caption: If I'm going to be stuck here with them, we might as well be friends.

images.description: The nymphs respond eagerly, clicking mandibles and consuming the offered mushrooms. One larger nymph looks directly at Howen, curious.
images.caption: That one's bigger than the others. Bolder too. It's staring at me.

images.description: The larger nymph approaches Howen cautiously. Up close, Howen can see a distinctive crack in its carapace forming a lightning bolt pattern.
images.caption: Careful, little one. I won't hurt you.

images.description: The nymph touches Howen's handle with its antennae. A spark of connection—Howen feels the insect's simple emotions. Hunger. Curiosity. Safety.
images.caption: I can feel it. Simple thoughts, simple feelings, but there. Hunger. Curiosity. And... it feels safe here. With me.

images.description: Montage of days passing—the garden expands, the nymphs become regular visitors, the crack-marked nymph always closest to Howen.
images.caption: Days pass. The garden grows. The insects become... family? Is that the right word for a farmer and her pests?

images.description: The crack-marked nymph (Chitin) sleeping curled against Howen's handle. Howen's core glows warmly—affection she didn't expect to feel.
images.caption: I've started calling this one Chitin. The crack in its shell... it looks like a lightning bolt. Distinctive. Special.

images.description: Sudden disturbance—the nymphs scatter in panic. A rumbling sound from the depths. Something larger is moving.
images.caption: No. Something's wrong. They're terrified.

images.description: From the darkness, a massive shape emerges—an adult megascarab, the size of a horse. Black-green carapace, massive mandibles. It approaches the garden.
images.caption: Mother. Or Queen. Or just... very, very big.

images.description: The adult megascarab examines the mushroom garden. Its antennae wave, sensing. It doesn't attack—instead, it seems... grateful?
images.caption: It's not attacking. It's... checking on the food source. On its children. On me.

images.description: Chitin approaches its mother, pressing against the massive leg. The adult nuzzles down. Family moment.
images.caption: Family. Even for insects, family matters.

images.description: The adult megascarab looks directly at Howen. For a moment, their eyes—one organic, one a glowing core—meet. An understanding passes.
images.caption: It knows I've been feeding them. Taking care of them. And it... accepts me.

images.description: The adult departs back into the darkness, but Chitin stays behind. It settles beside Howen, a choice made.
images.caption: Chitin doesn't follow. It chooses to stay with me. Its mother permits it. I have... a friend.

images.description: Time skip—Chitin has grown larger, now cat-sized. It helps tend the garden, turning soil with its mandibles. A partnership.
images.caption: Weeks pass. Chitin grows. We work together now. A farmer needs helpers, even in a tomb.

images.description: The garden has expanded dramatically. Organized sections—edible mushrooms, light mushrooms, and a careful patch of the volatile red ones.
images.caption: The garden is thriving. I've learned which mushrooms feed, which light, and which... might be useful later.

images.description: Howen's POV looking toward the vault wall. Beyond it, she can sense... something. Fresh air? Open space? A way out.
images.caption: I can feel something beyond that wall. Movement. Air. Life. The outside world.

images.description: Final panel—Howen beside Chitin, both looking at the same wall. The red boom mushrooms glow ominously in the background. A plan forming.
images.caption: I have a garden. I have a friend. And I have those explosive mushrooms. It's time to start planning my escape.
